body:
Comment 66: 
In both Go 1 and Go 1.1, in 32-bit mode, the memory allocator starts with a chunk of
768MB and then asks for additional chunks of 256MB as they are needed.  The Go 1.1
allocator is slightly cleverer but not really noticeably so.

Unfortunately I know very little about Go running in the Windows environment; I don't
know if there are any memory issues that arise on Windows but not elsewhere.
